meanings.definition: To release or relax a clenched muscle or fist.
meanings.sent1: She had to unclench her fist to pick up the delicate flower.
meanings.sent2: After the stressful meeting, he finally unclenched his jaw and relaxed.
meanings.sent3: Trying to open the jar, she had to unclench her hand first.
meanings.sent4: As the tension melted away, he unclenched his muscles like a spring unwinding.
meanings.sent5: The yoga instructor reminded the class to unclench their fists and breathe deeply.

meanings.definition: To open or loosen a tightly closed hand or fist.
meanings.sent1: He had to unclench his hand to grab the doorknob.
meanings.sent2: The child struggled to unclench her tiny fist from the toy car.
meanings.sent3: In a panic, she had to unclench her hand to reach for the emergency button.
meanings.sent4: The old rusty lock finally unclenched its grip on the treasure chest.
meanings.sent5: With a deep breath, he unclenched his fist and let go of the past.
